@liggitt Already included in this PR. See [pkg/api/fuzzer/fuzzer.go#L358-L366](https://github.com/dixudx/kubernetes/blob/5c45db564fb50c06b1658dcc5dc802725cb842c7/pkg/api/fuzzer/fuzzer.go#L358-L366). Can we do this in `SetDefaults_Container`? It seems `SetDefaults_Pod` not necessary :).

BTW, in beta, InitContainers is set after converting; so we're also ignore this for beta, right.
Read the comment at the top, it is not desired that this be applied to containers inside pod template objects
Correct! do you know why we did this only for Pod?
probably to avoid cluttering the pod spec inside objects like replicaset or deployment, when the only time the default matters is in the final pod
there are some proposals to skip defaulting altogether in pod specs inside objects like that, and keep the content of a deployment or replicaset limited to exactly what the user set

Just not sure which "case/proposal" ask to do that :). In other word, what may happen if we do it in `pod.spec`?

not debt, just want to learn more history & cases :).
the PodSpec object is reused in lots of objects, the intent of this is to only apply defaulting to one inside a Pod object

Yes, that's current behavior. One case in my mind is that: for the Pod, if request is not set, it is low priority (not defined in QoS??) which maybe killed. So set request for Pod to avoid eviction; it's OK to RC/RS which will start a new Pod.
And if it's the above case, it seems not necessary for initContainer :).
I would still prefer consistency, but well - it's not very important.
Add a note that this sets the requests to the limit if the request was not specified.
Done.
